page.title: 01S.W. EDINBURGH INTRODUCTION
page.content: { Our study area is located in S.W.Edinburgh and is predominantly a residential district.The houses closest to the town centre were mainly built of local stone during the late 19th Century,but towards the fringe of the city there are 20th Century Local Authority and private housing estates.We were surprised to find so much open space,some of which is being filled with small private housing developments.Colinton Dell, for example,is a peaceful,picturesque place where people can fish,paddle,picnic or stroll at leisure.Other interesting features include the Union Canal,which badly requires to be cleaned up,Longstone Bus Depot,Redford Barracks,Saughton Park Gardens and Craighouse Hospital.Our interviews included a girl who escaped by boat from Vietnam.
